In 1986, evangelist Jimmy Swaggart began on-screen attacks against fellow televangelists Marvin Gorman and Jim Bakker. He uncovered Gorman's affair with a member of Gorman's congregation, and also helped expose Bakker's infidelity (which was arranged by a colleague while on an out-of-state trip).<ref>{{cite news|url = http://transcripts.cnn.com/TRANSCRIPTS/0507/14/lkl.01.html|title = Transcript: Interview with Jessica Hahn|work = [[Larry King Live]]|publisher = [[CNN]]|date = 2005-07-14|accessdate = 2008-04-17}}</ref> These exposures received widespread media coverage. Gorman retaliated in kind by hiring a private investigator to uncover Swaggart's own adulterous indiscretions with a prostitute.<ref>{{Cite document|title = Swaggart Is Barred From Pulpit for One Year|publisher = [[New York Times]]|url = http://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=940DE6D7143EF933A05750C0A96E948260&sec=&spon=&pagewanted=all|date = 1998-03-30|accessdate = 2008-04-17|postscript = <!--None-->}}</ref> Swaggart was subsequently forced to step down from his pulpit for a year and made a tearful televised apology in February 1988 to his congregation, saying "I have sinned against you, my Lord, and I would ask that your precious blood would wash and cleanse every stain until it is in the seas of God's forgiveness."<ref>{{Cite document|url = http://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=940DE0D71F30F931A15751C0A96E948260&sec=&spon=&pagewanted=all|publisher = [[New York Times]]|title = Swaggart Says He Has Sinned; Will Step Down|first = Wayne|last = King|date = 1998-02-22|accessdate = 2008-04-17|postscript = <!--None-->}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url = http://americanrhetoric.com/speeches/jswaggartapologysermon.html|title = Reverend Jimmy Swaggart: Apology Sermon|accessdate = 2007-01-25|last = Swaggart|first = Jimmy|publisher = americanrhetoric.com}}</ref>
